Detailed Description

The class for exporting vCard from Contacts information.

The following example demonstrates how to use the VCardExporter class.

 gaia::core::Context* context = new gaia::core::Context(this);
 gaia::vcard::VCardExporter* exporter = new gaia::vcard::VCardExporter(context);
 if (!exporter->init()) {
     GLOG(LOG_TAG, LOGER, "fail to init()");
 }
 while (!exporter->isAfterLast()) {
     gaia::base::String vcard = exporter->createOneEntry();
     if (vcard == NULL) {
         GLOG(LOG_TAG, LOGER, "vcard is null");
     } else {
         GLOG(LOG_TAG, LOGINFO, "vcard: %s", vcard->string());
     }
 }
 exporter->terminate();

Users have to manually take care of memory efficiency. Even one vCard may contain image of non-trivial size for mobile devices.

Definition at line 54 of file VCardExporter.h.

bool gaia::vcard::VCardExporter::init ( )

Initializes this object using default gaia::content::AddressBook::CONTACTSLIST_CONTENT_URI.

You can call this method just once. In other words, you cannot reuse this object.

Returns:
Returns true when initialization is successful and all the other methods are available. Returns false otherwise.

bool gaia::vcard::VCardExporter::isAfterLast ( )
Returns:
true when there's no entity to be built. The return value is undefined when this object is not ready yet.
void gaia::vcard::VCardExporter::setPhoneNumberTranslationCallback ( const VCardPhoneNumberTranslationCallback &  callback)

Set a callback for phone number formatting.

It will be called every time when this object receives a phone number for printing.

When this is set VCardConfig#FLAG_REFRAIN_PHONE_NUMBER_FORMATTING will be ignored and the callback should be responsible for everything about phone number formatting.

Caution: This interface will change. Please don't use without any strong reason.
